Cell.Data: The DEV TEAM / MISC NOTES column contains info on what text between { } signs means (if applicable). It usually stands for either a numeric value, or a numeric value with an icon. Text between [ ] signs stands for a certain type of icon.
This is the name of a unit.

“Fools! Thinking our orchestra tamed Thundermaw swarmlings?! Imagine a flower-like, cat-dinosaur hybrid and you’ll picture what surrounded our ensemble. Silly though the creatures looked, they were immediately enraged by the bassoonists. With savage clacking claws, it shredded a violinist on its way to pouncing on the flautists. Swarmlings unleashed blasts of concussive force, through the pulsating amplifiers encircling its head—more powerful than a thousand kettledrums. Cellos and cellists went flying. Though the audience fled with severe lacerations before the first movement completed, that performance still ranks higher than any Dvar opera.” -- Maestro Landon Hughes, “RV-579437E: Philharmonic Fails”

“蠢货！以为我们的管弦乐队驯服了雷嘴兽灵？！想象一下，一种长得像花一样的猫与恐龙的杂交体，你就知道围困我们的东西长什么样了。虽然这些东西看起来很蠢，但它们立刻就被低音管的声音给激怒了。在它们扑向笛手的途中，只听见咔哒一声，野蛮的爪子便撕碎了一名小提琴手。雷嘴兽灵透过环绕在头部的脉冲增强器释放出了一阵冲击力，威力比上千面铜鼓齐奏还要庞大。大提琴和大提琴手被震飞在空中。虽然在第一乐章还未演奏完毕之前，身受重伤的观众们就已经四散逃离，但这次表演仍然在矮人歌剧院的历史中留下了浓墨重彩的一笔。”——音乐大师兰登·休斯，“RV-579437E：失败的乐团”

This is a unit description. I.e. a bit of flavor text about the unit that gives an insight into the lore of the game. This takes the form of a quote - from a book, diary, journal, etc - followed by the source. A lot of them try to get across some of the humor Triumph is known for.
This is the name of a unit.

“Repent little children or you’ll quickly be found[br/][br/]By a terrible creature—a monster most foul. Its dire claws can slash even trees into jelly,[br/][br/]Imagine it slicing into your soft little belly! Its roar is explosive, as it shrugs off all bullets,[br/][br/]It never calms down ‘til you’re devoured in its gullet![br/][br/]So do all your chores and obedient be,[br/][br/]Take your all meds and walk reverently. You don’t want to summon its click-clacking claws,[br/][br/]Be perfect, or there comes a swift-stalking Thundermaw!”[br/]– Ms. Killian Mur Derva, “RV-7467E: Rhymes for Spoiled Children.”

“承认自己的错误，小孩，否则你很快就会[br/][br/]被一个可怕的生物抓走，一个最邪恶的怪物。它可怕的爪子甚至能把树木砍成烂泥。[br/][br/]想象一下那爪子把你柔软的小肚子切成碎片的感觉吧！它的咆哮如同爆炸，仿佛所有子弹在它面前都毫无作用。[br/][br/]它永远都冷静不下来，直到把你一口吞了！[br/][br/]所以，做好你的家务，乖乖听父母的话。[br/][br/]一定要按时吃药，走路的姿势不能太张扬。否则，那咔哒作响的爪子再次出现。[br/][br/]记得要做个完美的小孩，否则那个跟着你的雷嘴兽就会突然出现！”[br/]——基利安·穆尔·德瓦女士，“RV-7467E：为娇生惯养的孩子准备的童谣。”

This is a unit description. I.e. a bit of flavor text about the unit that gives an insight into the lore of the game. This takes the form of a quote - from a book, diary, journal, etc - followed by the source. A lot of them try to get across some of the humor Triumph is known for.
This is the name of a unit.

“Unlike their party-loving Therian kin, Shepherds have tranquil souls. I’ve had many enlightening exchanges with these solitary Sheep-humanoids. They seek to nourish their wild flocks. Once though, I was deceived by farmers who’d been hunting a Shepherd’s flock. Each time I sought peaceful resolution, he showed me wounded animals he’d healed with his Bio-Staff. Vengeance drove the ram-man mad. He transformed his flock of juvenile beasts to fully matured monsters. Their stampede leveled the town. Not one of my best diplomatic moments, but I like to think lessons were learned. Never lie to your diplomatic envoy.” –Mah Reg’Nib, “RV4067D: Diplomancy”

“与热爱派对的兽人不同，牧羊人有着平静的灵魂。我和这些孤独的类羊人进行过多次深受启迪的交流。他们想要养育那些野生羊群。但有一次，我被那些猎杀牧羊人羊群的农民给骗了。每当我寻求和平的解决方法时，他就会给我看他用生化法杖治愈了的那些受伤的动物。复仇使那个羊人变得疯狂，他把他的幼羊群变成了生长成熟的怪物，它们踏平了整个城镇。这不是我最值得纪念的外交时刻，但我至少从中吸取了教训——永远不要对外交官撒谎。”——玛·瑞格尼布，“RV4067D：外交学”
